io.github.utk003.util.misc

Class Verify

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.utk003.util.misc.Verify

  • public abstract class Verify
extends Object
    An abstract utility class for verification functions.

    This class provides these methods:

    • The requireTrue methods, which throw an IllegalArgumentException if and only if the given boolean expression evaluates to false.
    • The requireFalse methods, which throw an IllegalArgumentException if and only if the given boolean expression evaluates to true.
    • The requireNull methods, which throw an IllegalArgumentException if and only if the given object expression is not null.
    • The requireNotNull methods, which throw an IllegalArgumentException if and only if the given object expression is null.
    Since:
    1.0.2
    Version:
    January 13, 2021
    Author:
    Utkarsh Priyam

    • Method Detail

      • requireTrue

        @Contract(value="false -> fail")
public static void requireTrue(boolean bool)
        Throws an IllegalArgumentException if and only if the given boolean argument is not true.

        If an exception is thrown, it is initialized with a null message.

        Parameters:
        bool - The boolean argument to check
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the boolean argument is not true
        See Also:
        requireTrue(boolean, String)

        If an exception is thrown, it is initialized with the specified message.

      • requireNotNull

        @Contract(value="null -> fail")
public static void requireNotNull(@Nullable
                                                                  @Nullable Object obj)
        Throws an IllegalArgumentException if and only if the given Object argument is not not-null or equivalently is null.

        If an exception is thrown, it is initialized with a null message.

        For a method with identical functionality that returns the argument as well, use Objects.requireNonNull(Object) instead.

        Parameters:
        obj - The Object argument to check
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the Object argument is null
        See Also:
        requireNull(Object, String), Objects.requireNonNull(Object)

      • requireNotNull

        @Contract(value="null,_ -> fail")
public static void requireNotNull(@Nullable
                                                                    @Nullable Object obj,
                                                                    String message)
        Throws an IllegalArgumentException if and only if the given Object argument is not not-null or equivalently is null.

        If an exception is thrown, it is initialized with the specified message.

        For a method with identical functionality that returns the argument as well, use Objects.requireNonNull(Object, String) instead.

        Parameters:
        obj - The Object argument to check
        message - The message for the exception
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the Object argument is null
        See Also:
        requireNull(Object, String), Objects.requireNonNull(Object, String)
